instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to differentiate between idiopathic membranous nephropathy (IMN) and hepatitis B virus-related membranous nephropathy (HBV-MN)?
Output: The related study used visible spectrum and nir spectrum to differentiate between idiopathic membranous nephropathy (IMN) and hepatitis B virus-related membranous nephropathy (HBV-MN).

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to differentiate between idiopathic membranous nephropathy (IMN) and hepatitis B virus-related membranous nephropathy (HBV-MN)?
Output: Deep learning-based framework for processing hyperspectral images of renal biopsy tissue was used to differentiate between idiopathic membranous nephropathy (IMN) and hepatitis B virus-related membranous nephropathy (HBV-MN) based on the component of their immune complex deposition.

instruction: What metric was chosen to differentiate between idiopathic membranous nephropathy (IMN) and hepatitis B virus-related membranous nephropathy (HBV-MN), and how far can this metric go?
Output: Hyperspectral imaging was chosen as the metric to differentiate between idiopathic membranous nephropathy (IMN) and hepatitis B virus-related membranous nephropathy (HBV-MN). This metric has shown potential for noninvasive disease diagnosis and surgical guidance.

instruction: How did the researchers train the deep learning-based framework to differentiate between idiopathic membranous nephropathy (IMN) and hepatitis B virus-related membranous nephropathy (HBV-MN)?
Output: The researchers trained the deep learning-based framework using hyperspectral images of renal biopsy tissue to define the difference between IMN and HBV-MN based on the component of their immune complex deposition.

instruction: Can the deep learning-based framework using hyperspectral images be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for diagnosing membranous nephropathy, based on the achieved overall accuracy of 95.04% in classifying IMN and HBV-MN?
Output: Yes, the deep learning-based framework using hyperspectral images can be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for diagnosing membranous nephropathy. This is supported by the achieved overall accuracy of 95.04% in classifying idiopathic membranous nephropathy (IMN) and hepatitis B virus-related membranous nephropathy (HBV-MN). The deep learning algorithm outperformed support vector machine (SVM)-based algorithms, indicating its potential as a new and more effective method for aiding in the diagnosis of membranous nephropathy.
